This video tells the story of a historic spring. On March 17th we closed our schools due to the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic. But what happened next is what will be remembered... Students adapted to virtual learning at home. Teachers completely changed their game plan with just a day's notice. Our technology team put a device in every single student's hands. Our food service and transportation staff teamed up to serve and deliver over 300,000 meals to Lebanon kids.

In hard times, the Lebanon community always links arms to take care of one another.

While the upcoming school year may not look normal, we know this much... Our students and staff are adaptive and resilient. We will get through this together, Lebanon Strong.

Thank you to Conner Mobley for telling our story through this video.

post_text: Congratulations to our LR3 Transportation team on earning the Total Fleet Excellence Award again this year! School districts receiving a 90% or higher approval rating on the annual MO State Highway Patrol school bus inspection receive the Total Fleet Excellence Award. This year, the Lebanon Public Schools' transportation department earned a 97.4% pass rate on the inspection. The statewide approval rate was 89.1%. Successful maintenance of a pupil transportation fleet is a team effort. We appreciate and congratulate our hardworking transportation team. We want to give a special shoutout to the mechanic team of Dave Cates, Russell Shumate, and Seth McBride as well as Bill Thorsen, Melissa McClanahan and David Case for helping prepare the buses! They all worked very hard to have everything ready for the rigorous inspection.

This annual scholarship is named after Ramona Boswell, who was a teacher at Lebanon Junior High School for many years. Mrs. Boswell believed everyone should conduct himself or herself with honor. She stated, "Self-respect is the highest honor one can achieve." Mrs. Boswell started the annual honors assembly at LJHS. The assembly bares her name to honor her service and loyalty to our school. This award is given to six 8th grade students who have excelled at the highest level in academics, integrity, and effort and that have demonstrated self-respect and contributed to their school community. This scholarship has been funded by the Boswell Family for the past 42 years.

Alternates: Drew Bowling, Cross Pezzetti, Grace Simpson,
Sadie Rinck, Sadie Douglas, Wyatt Carr

Did you know that the Lebanon School District sends out text alerts to parents/guardians and emergency contacts? These are the fastest way to receive information about topics like emergency notifications, delayed buses, inclement weather days, and other news and resources. Unlike our phone calls, users must opt-in to receive text messages. Texts are only available to those who are listed as a contact in our student information system.

To sign up, text "Yes" to 68453

Other things to know:
If you do not receive a confirmation text within a couple of minutes, we may not have your correct cell phone number in our student information system. Simply call your school office to update your number.
Standard data and message rates may apply according to your cellular plan
These are one-way messages, meaning that you will not be able to reply
Users are able to opt-out of the messages at any time

post_text: This afternoon, Lebanon School District officials were notified that an elementary student was in possession of a handgun during the bus ride home today, March 11th. The weapon was immediately confiscated and secured by the bus driver. Law enforcement was notified immediately and both the weapon and student were released into police custody. We commend the efforts of the bus driver and students on board for their quick and decisive actions to maintain the safety for all students on board. There is no safety threat to other students or staff at this time. We will continue to partner with law enforcement as this investigation continues, and we appreciate their swift work in this situation. The safety and security of our students and staff are always our utmost priority.
